text: Q2. Academic year
Q3. Please indicate which schools you have majors in

responses.text: Weinberg College of Arts and Sciences
McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science
School of Education and Social Policy
Medill School of Journalism, Media, and Integrated Marketing Communications

text: Q4. Residence
Q5. Do you receive need-based financial aid from Northwestern University?
Q6. Please indicate the level of IMPORTANCE of the following potential long-term investments

responses.text: Create a nondenominational prayer room in Tech
Improving equipment in student recreation facilities (e.g. rock climbing facility)
Increasing the amount of rehearsal or performance space available for student groups

text: Q7. Please indicate the level of IMPORTANCE of the following potential annual, short-term budgetary items.

responses.text: Improving mental health services at Northwestern (e.g. additional programs)
Invite prominent and wellknown speakers to campus
Improving textbook affordability via online sources or Quartet course packets
Providing additional funding for club sports teams
Providing additional funding for events that promote faculty-student interaction outside of the classroom
Increasing support for diversity and inclusion initiatives at Northwestern
Providing university-sponsored, late-night activities where alcohol is not served

text: Q8. In this section, you are asked to indicate the HIGHEST PRIORITIES of the items that you marked as “Very Important” large scale, long term investments. You have 100 points that you can distribute among the items listed below. Give the most points to the item(s) that are most important. You may choose to divide the points in any way you like, however you must use all of your points. For example, you may: Give all 100 points to one item and 0 points to everything else, OR You can split the points evenly among all items, OR You can choose separate point values for each item that total to 100.

responses.text: Creating a non-denominational prayer room in Tech
Improving equipment in existing athletic facilities (e.g. new rock climbing facility)
Increasing the amount of rehearsal/performance space available

text: Q9. In this section, you are asked to indicate the HIGHEST PRIORITIES of the items that you marked as “Very Important” annual, short-term budgetary items. You have 100 points that you can distribute among the items listed below. Give the most points to the item(s) that are most important. You may choose to divide the points in any way you like, however you must use all of your points.For example, you may: Give all 100 points to one item and 0 points to everything else, OR You can split the points evenly among all items, OR You can choose separate point values for each item that total to 100

responses.text: Improving mental health services at Northwestern (e.g. additional programs)
Invite prominent and wellknown speakers to campus
Improving textbook affordability via online sources or Quartet course packets
Providing additional funding for club sports teams
Providing additional funding for events that promote faculty-student interaction outside of the classroom
Increasing support for diversity and inclusion initiatives at Northwestern
Providing university-sponsored, late-night activities where alcohol is not served

text: Q10. (Freshmen) Please rate your agreement or disagreement with the following statements.

responses.text: After meeting with an academic adviser, I feel comfortable with the classes I have chosen for next quarter.

text: Q11. (Freshmen) Indicate the two sources of information that are most important to your advising experience:
Q12. (Non-Freshmen) Please rate your agreement or disagreement with the following statements.

responses.text: I feel comfortable going to my adviser about academic questions.
My adviser is available whenever I need help.

text: Q13. If you have an adviser beyond your major-specific one, do you use your primary major adviser more or your additional adviser more?
Q14. Please rate your agreement or disagreement with the following statements.

responses.text: I believe that Northwestern's major and minor offerings are comprehensive.
Multiple midterms on the same day have caused me stress within the last year.
Professors are accommodating about making exceptions to extend deadlines for projects, papers, and exams.
Being released from school in mid-June has prevented me from applying to or getting my preferred internship or job.
Knowing course material cost estimates and methods of evaluation (exams, papers, projects, etc.) at the time of registration is important in my decision to take a course.
It is easy for me to find my degree audit (degree progress report).
My financial situation has prevented me from purchasing course materials or enrolling in a class with certain required materials.
I would recommend Northwestern to a younger sibling or a younger friend.

text: Q15. Do you have access to old exams through a test bank?
Q16. Upon receiving an internship offer, I have had to miss spring quarter final exams.
Q17. (Among those who selected True for Q16) Because of my internship offer, I had to:

responses.text: Withdraw from a class or classes
Reschedule my exams to occur before my internship began

text: Q18. Please rank the following commitments in order from largest to smallest source of stress (drag the options to rank, 1 is Largest Source of Stress, 5 is Smallest Source of Stress).
Q19. Choose the best option from below that would help reduce academic stress the most at Northwestern.

responses.text: Fewer number of credits for graduation requirement
Making three-class quarters the norm, instead of four-class quarters
Re-evaluating the number of credits allocated to a course (ex. changing science lab credits from 0.34 to 1)

text: Q20. How do you currently access library resources?

responses.text: I do not access library resources.

text: Q21. I have completed a course with required readings that are provided in a scanned form (rather than requiring the purchase of the entire book/textbook).
Q22. (Among those who selected True for Q21) Which option do you agree with most?

responses.text: Professors should have course packets available only through Quartet.
Professors should only have online course packets.
Professors should offer both online and Quartet course packets.

text: Q23. (Non-Freshmen) Have you done the following to save money instead of purchasing physical course materials from Northwestern-affiliated stores?

responses.text: Used free online copies of required course materials
Checked out a required course material from the library
Used international or outdated versions of required course materials

text: Q24. Please rate your agreement or disagreement with the following statements.

responses.text: The quarter system was one of the reasons why I applied to Northwestern.
I would prefer another system, like semesters or J-terms (month-long period in January with different course offerings) over a quarter system.
I am satisfied with the amount of material covered per course per quarter.
I would prefer starting and ending earlier in the year, to keep in line with other schools
The quarter system has too many assessments (exams, papers, projects, etc.)

text: Q25. Have you ever used the Student-Faculty Interaction Grant?
Q26. (Among those who selected Yes for Q25) On average, how often do you use the Student-Faculty Interaction Grant per quarter?
Q27. (Among those who selected Yes for Q25) How satisfied were you with the grant and the activities that were funded by the Student-Faculty Interaction Grant?
Q28. (Among those who answered Dissatisfied/Very Dissastisfied for Q27) What part of the grant and the grant process do you believe needs most alteration? (Please select all that apply)

responses.text: The amount of time required for a grant to be confirmed
The activities funded by the grant

text: Q29. (Among those who answered No for Q25) Why have you never used the Student-Faculty Interaction Grant?

responses.text: I have never heard of the grant.
I have never had the opportunity to use the grant.
I have never wanted to use the grant.

text: Q30. Please rate your agreement or disagreement with the following statements.

responses.text: There are strong, positive relationships between Northwestern students and permanent Evanston residents.
I feel safe when walking alone around Evanston and surrounding off-campus neighborhoods.
There are enough blue lights on and around campus.

text: Q31. I have visited the Chicago campus in the last year.
Q32. I would like to see more space dedicated to undergraduates on the Chicago campus.
Q33. (Among those who answered Yes for Q32) I would like for the undergraduate space on the Chicago campus to include (select all that apply)
Q34. (Among those who answered Yes for Q32) I would visit a dedicated undergraduate space on the Chicago campus...

Q35. ASG hopes to increase interactions between Northwestern student groups and similar Evanston Township High School (ETHS) student groups; partnerships would entail a monthly meeting with the ETHS group for an hour to two hours. During the meeting, NU student groups would teach, inspire, and mentor the related ETHS group.

responses.text: If such a program were in place, I/my affiliated student groups would participate.

text: Q36. Please rate your agreement or disagreement with the following statements.

responses.text: Having a centralized university center that serves as the hub of student life is important.
There is a sufficient amount of small group meetings on campus.
I am satisfied with the student recreation facilities in SPAC, Blomquist, and Patten.

text: Q37. (Among those who answered Disagree/Strongly Disagree for "There is a sufficient amount of small group meetings on campus." for Q36) Where should additional meeting spaces be located?  Please select all that apply.

responses.text: Other academic buildings (e.g. Harris Hall, University Hall)

text: Q38. (Among those who answered Disagree/Strongly Disagree for "I am satisfied with the student recreation facilities in SPAC, Blomquist, and Patten." for Q36) Which aspects of the athletic facilities should be improved? Please select all that apply.
Q39. Please rate your agreement or disagreement with the following statements.

responses.text: There are sufficient filtered water stations available on campus.
Northwestern should dedicate more funds to reducing energy consumption.
I or my student groups would use reusable plates and silverware from Sodexo if they were available for free.

text: Q40. Please rank in order of importance which sustainable options you would like to see implemented at Northwestern. (drag the options to rank, 1 is Most Important, 4 is Least Important)
Q41. Please rate your agreement or disagreement with the following statements.

responses.text: I am satisfied with the dining options available on campus.
Northwestern offers enough dining options to meet any dietary restrictions or concerns that I have.
The current on- campus dining options have sufficient/convenient operating hours.

text: Q42. (Among those who answered Disagree/Strongly Disagree for "The current on- campus dining options have sufficient/convenient operating hours." for Q41) What additional dining hours should be available?
Q43. Which forms of advertising do you think are most effective? (Please pick top 3)

responses.text: Word of mouth from my academic focus
Word of mouth from my resident assistant

text: Q44. Please rate your agreement or disagreement with the following statements.

responses.text: I feel that ASG’s services reflect my needs as a Northwestern student.

text: Q45. Please rate your agreement or disagreement with the following statements.

responses.text: Northwestern provides sufficient and affordable on- campus printing facilities for students.

text: Q46. How many times have you attended NU Nights in your time at Northwestern?
Q47. (Among those who did NOT answer 0 for Q46) Please rate your agreement or disagreement with the following statements.

responses.text: I am likely to attend NU Nights again.
I would recommend NU Nights to other students.

text: Q48. Did you attend A&O’s Fall Blowout this year?
Q49. (Among those who answered Yes to Q48) Please indicate your level of satisfaction with the following aspects of Fall Blowout.
Q50. (Among those who answered No to Q48) Why did you not attend the event? Select all that apply.
Q51. How many times a week do you experience Wi-Fi issues while on the Northwestern network?
Q53. Please rate your agreement or disagreement with the following statement.

responses.text: I find CAESAR difficult to navigate.

text: Q54. I have experienced difficulty with the following features on CAESAR. (Please select all that apply)
Q61. Have you used the NU Listens hotline in the last quarter?
Q62. (Among those who answered Yes for Q61) Using the NU Listens hotline was beneficial to my mental health.
Q63. (Among those who answered No for Q61) Have you heard of the NU Listens hotline?

Q64. (Among those who answered No for Q63) NU Listens is a free, confidential peer listening service that students can call. It is meant to create a safe, confidential, non-judgmental environment where students can talk about anything they want. Now knowing what it is, please rate the extent to which you agree with the following statement.

responses.text: I would consider using the NU Listens hotline to improve my mental health.

text: Q65. Please rate the extent to which you agree with the following statements.

responses.text: I was unable to participate in a student group due to financial reasons.
Student group recruitment at Northwestern is too competitive.
Rejection by student groups has had a significant effect on my happiness at NU.

text: Q66. To the best of your ability, about how many hours per week do you spend on student group involvement?
Q67. (Freshmen) To the best of your ability, about how many student groups did you apply to in this quarter (Fall 2015)?
Q68. (Non-Freshmen) To the best of your ability, about how many student groups did you apply to in the last academic year?
Q69. (Freshmen who did NOT answer 0 for Q67) From how many student groups were you NOT accepted to this quarter (Fall 2015)?
Q70. (Non-Freshmen who did NOT answer 0 for Q68) To the best of your ability, from how many student groups were you NOT accepted to the last academic year?
Q71. Have you ever participated in a Take Time event?
Q72. (Among those who answered Yes for Q71) How did you hear about the Take Time event?
Q73. (Among those who answered Yes for Q71) Please rate the extent to which you agree with the following statement regarding Take Time.

responses.text: I leave Take Time feeling less stressed.

text: Q74. (Among those who answered No for Q71) Why didn’t you attend a Take Time event?

responses.text: I did not know about the event until it was over.
The times did not fit my schedule.
I didn’t know what the campaign was.
I didn’t feel the campaign was related to me.

text: Q75. Please rate the extent to which you agree with the following statement.

responses.text: Northwestern has a culture that encourages students to set aside free time.

text: Q76. Please rate the extent to which you agree with the following statement regarding Northwestern's shuttles.

responses.text: I am satisfied with the shuttle stop locations.
I am satisfied with the shuttle pickup times.
I am satisfied with the space/ crowdedness of the shuttle.
The shuttle pickup times are reliable.

text: Q77. Please rate the degree to which you agree with the following statements.

responses.text: I support the initiative to implement a U.S. Based Diversity and Social Inequalities class requirement in Weinberg.
Northwestern adequately responds to instances of racism on campus.
Northwestern adequately responds to instances of racism in the nation at large.

I believe that the majority of professors at Northwestern make an effort to enforce an inclusive classroom environment and teach considering the different experiences students may have based on identity.
Most spaces and buildings at Northwestern are accessible to students regardless of ability status.

text: Q78. Do you have an identity that is marginalized at Northwestern through gender, race, sexual orientation, ability status, ethnicity, nationality or religion?

Q79. (Among those who answered Yes for Q78) If you have an identity that is marginalized at Northwestern through gender, race, sexual orientation, ability status, ethnicity, nationality or religion, please rate the extent to which you agree with the following statements.

responses.text: I have been supported in this identity and given the chance to access students with similar experiences.
I believe that certain student groups and organizations implicitly exclude students based on identity.
